resources.string: "PANDUWA HALMAL DANDIYA"

Scientific name :- Rasboroides pallidus

\n
  • Family :- Cyprinidae
  • English name :- Pallid Rasbora
  • Sinhala name :- Panduwan Halmal dandiya
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): NE
  • Global (2018):

• Location :- Found in Kalu to Nilwala river basins
  • Environment :- Found in shallow, slow-flowing, densely shaded lowland rain-foconted streams with a sandy-silt substrate
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 24.6cm
  • Identification features :-
    Males have same color unbranched rays on dorsal, anal, pectoral and pelvic fins.

    Females have greater body depth

    Origin of pelvic fin slightly anterior to vertical through origin of dorsal fin
  • Other :- N/A
"RATHUWARALA DEPULLIYA"

Scientific name :- Pethiya reval

\n
  • Family :- Cyprinidae
  • English name :- Sri Lanka Red-fined Barb
  • Sinhala name :- Rathuwaral depulliya
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): EN
  • Global (2018):

• Location :- Found in Kelani to Kalu river basins
  • Environment :- Found in flowing or still, clear streams with a sandy-muddy substrate
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 3cm
  • Identification features :-
    • Dorsal, anal, and pelvic fins are red

    Two elongated blotches
  • Other :- N/A
"DAMKOLA SAALAYA"

Scientific name :- Devario malabaricus

\n
  • Family :- Cyprinidae
  • English name :- Giant Danio
  • Sinhala name :- Damkola saalaya
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): LC
  • Global (2018):

• Location :- Found in wet, dry and intermediate zones
  • Environment :- Found in variety of habitats from small streams to tanks with clear or murky water
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 8cm
  • Identification features :-
    • P stripe anteriorly divided P, P+1 and P-1 stripes pconent anterior to caudal peduncle
  • Other :- N/A
"DAMKOLA PETHIYA"

Scientific name :- Dawkinsia singhala

\n
  • Family :- Cyprinidae
  • English name :- Sri Lanka Filamented Barb
  • Sinhala name :- Damkola pethiya
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): LC
  • Global (2018):

• Location :- Found in wet, dry and intermediate zones
  • Environment :- Found in variety of habitats from fast/slow flowing streams to tanks
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 7-8cm
  • Identification features :-
    no distinct marks on caudal fin lobes or on body in advance of anal fin origin
  • Other :-
    Filamentous dorsal fin with elongated rays are absent in females

    Juveniles have 3 black bands on body which fade with maturity (Except band above anal fin)
"WAIRAN AHIRAWA"

Scientific name :- Lepidocephalichthys thermalis

\n
  • Family :- Cobitidae
  • English name :- Common Spiny Loach
  • Sinhala name :- Ahirava, Wairan ahirava
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): CR
  • Global (2018):

• Location :- Found in wet, dry and intermediate zones
  • Environment :- Found in variety of habitats from streams to tanks, lagoons and canals
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 5cm
  • Identification features :-
    Truncate/rounded caudal fin

    No scales on top of the head

    3-5 board dark bars on the caudal fins
  • Other :-
    • Males have slender body with darker colors

    Females are little lager than male
"PULUTTA"

Scientific name :- Pseudosphromenus cupanus

\n
  • Family :- Belontidae
  • English name :- Spike Tailed Paradise Fish
  • Sinhala name :- Pulutta
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): LC
  • Global (2018):

• Location :- Found in wet zones
  • Environment :- Found in still water habitats
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 8cm
  • Identification features :-
    Adult males have extended dorsal, anal and caudal fins

    First rays of pelvic fins and center ray of caudal fin elongated with a filament
  • Other :- Females and juveniles are darken in color with shorter filaments
"WILPITA DANDIYA"

Scientific name :- Rasbora wilpita

\n
  • Family :- Cyprinidae
  • English name :- Sri Lanka Wilpita Rasbora
  • Sinhala name :- Wilpita dandiya
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): EN
  • Global (2018):

• Location :- Found in Kelani to Nilwala river basins
  • Environment :- Found in Shaded slow flowing streams with muddy or leafy substrates
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 8 cm
  • Identification features :-
    Elongated body with terminal mouth

    Prominent symphysial knob on lower jaw

    Conspicuous lateral concesses on premaxillary
  • Other :- No sexual dimorphism
"PULLI AHIRAVA"

Scientific name :- Lepidocephalichthys jonklaasi

\n
  • Family :- Cobitidae
  • English name :- Sri Lanka Jonklaas\'s Loach
  • Sinhala name :- Ahirava, Pulli ahirava
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): CR
  • Global (2018):

• Location :- Found in Kelani to Nilwala river basins/li>
  • Environment :- Found in Shaded slow flowing streams with muddy or leafy substrates
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 5 cm
  • Identification features :-
    There is a dark stripe from eye to upper lip/br>
    Three pairs of barbels pconent

    Vertically elongated blotch on the end of caudal peduncle
  • Other :- This species can be overlapping with Lepidocephalichthys thermalis
"MALPULUTTA"

Scientific name :- Malpulutta kretseris

  • Family :- Belontidae
  • English name :- Sri Lanka Ornate Paradise Fish
  • Sinhala name :- Malpulutta
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): CR
  • Global (2018) : LC-

• Location :- Found in Kalu to Niwala river basins
  • Environment :- Found in small, shallow, slow flowing silted streams
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 4 cm
  • Identification features :-
    Dorsal and anal fins are pointed with filaments

    First ray of pelvic fin are elongated with filaments

    2-3 middle rays of lanceololate caudal fin elongated with filaments

    Have two dark lines which start from snout to posterior end of the operculum
  • Other :- Females and juveniles lack the elongated filaments and the blue tint on the fins, Males are larger and more colorful than females, Females and juveniles can be overlapping with Pseudosphromenus cupanus
"THOL RATHU WELIGOWWA"

Scientific name :- Sicyopus jonklaasi

\n
  • Family :- Gobiidae
  • English name :- Sri Lanka Lipstick Gobyb
  • Sinhala name :- Thol rathu weligowwa
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): EN

• Global (2018): DD-
  • Location :- Found in Kelani to Nilwala river basins
  • Environment :- Found in rocky mid-hill streams with fast flowing water
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 5 cm
  • Identification features :-
    Male brownish to yellowish with bright red lips

    Bright red colored elliptical blotch found in base of the caudal fin
  • Other :- Females Lack of red color in the body
"GAL WELIGOWWA"

Scientific name :- Sicyopterus halei

\n
  • Family :- Gobiidae
  • English name :- Red-Tailed Goby
  • Sinhala name :- Gal weligowwa
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): CR
  • Global (2018) :DD

• Location :- Found in Kelani to Gin river basin
  • Environment :- Found in rocky mid-hill streams with fast flowing water
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 8 cm
  • Identification features :-
    7-8 dark blotches can be found in dorsal and lateral sides of the body

    Second ray of the first dorsal fin is elongated
  • Other :- N/A
"KATA RATHU WELIGOWWA"

Scientific name :- Schismatogobius deraniyagalai

\n
  • Family :- Gobiidae
  • English name :- Red-Neck Goby
  • Sinhala name :- Kata rathu weligowwa
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): EN
  • Global (2018) : DD

• Location :- Restricted to wet zone
  • Environment :- Found in shallow areas of rivers with sandy, coarse sand or gravel substrate
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 4-5 cm
  • Identification features :-
    4-5 irregular black spots found along lateral line of the body

    A large, vertically elongated, oval spot at base of caudal fin

    Gape reaching backwards almost to preopercle angle in males and to middle of eye in females

    In males, the chin and throat are orange-red. Inside of mouth of male’s bright red
  • Other :- Females are dull in color
"DANKUDA PETHIYA"

Scientific name :- Dawkinsia srilankensis

\n
  • Family :- Cyprinidae
  • English name :- Sri Lanka Blotched Filamented Barb
  • Sinhala name :- Dankuda pethiya
  • IUCN Status :- Local (2012): VU
  • Global (2018) :

• Location :- Found in Kalu to Nilwala river basins
  • Environment :- Found in shaded shallow rivers
  • Maximum length :- Can be grow up to 10 cm
  • Identification features :- Pelvic fins are absent
  • Other :- This species can be overlapping with Channa kelrtii
